metadata.title: CVE-2024-10461 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In multipart/x-mixed-replace responses, `Content-Disposition: attachment`in the response header was not respected and did not force a download,which could allow XSS attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 132,Firefox ESR < 128.4, Thunderbird < 128.4, and Thunderbird < 132.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-10461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
